greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Nonludicity of n.
comment: If n is ludic, a(n)=0; if n is nonludic, a(n) is the step at which n is rejected from the ludic number sieve.
link: Max Barrentine, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
xref: Cf. A265859 (analogous version for lucky numbers).
results.author: _Max Barrentine_, Apr 07 2016
